publications: [{"title":"Balaji Telefilms Limited","subtitle":"Harvard Business Publishing","date":"October 1, 2019","description":"Case Study that examines the rise of Balaji Telefilms to become India's preeminent TV content producer, its entry into the film business, and subsequently, into the online streaming industry. The case has 4 broad learning objectives - 1) Understand how Balaji has transformed the TV content industry and what are the reasons behind its success in the TV industry. 2) Understand how to evaluate a firm's diversification moves using Porter's three tests: the attractiveness test, the cost-of-entry test and the better-off test. 3) Understand how the presence (or lack) of synergies between a firm's businesses can help (or constrain) a firm's diversification strategy. 4) Develop strategies for competing in the digital entertainment industry."}]
